name: Shoulder Width Three-Point Push-Up
how_to_perform:
1. Start with your hands shoulder-width apart and directly under your shoulders on a flat surface, engaging your core and keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels.
2. Lower the left side of your body towards the ground, keeping your right arm extended, while maintaining a 90-degree angle at the bottom of the movement.
3. Push back up to the starting position by extending your arms, then immediately proceed with lowering the right side of your body towards the ground and pushing it back up to replicate the same motion on that side.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, alternating sides in a controlled manner throughout the exercise.
short_summary: The Shoulder Width Three-Point Push-Up targets multiple muscle groups by applying pressure through hands and feet.
alternative_names: Shoulder Width Hand and Feet Push-Up
